page.title: 13Royal Leamington Spa, Cinema
page.content: Leamington Spa is lucky enough to have one of the 15 largest cinemas in the U.K. The Regal Cinema was built in 1931, was then reconstructed and modernised in 1969 because it was considered unsafe. In the auditorium there are 904 seats divided into 2 sections, smoking in the middle and non-smoking on the outside. The loud speakers are behind the netted screen which is curved so that everyone gets a good view. The sound effect speakers are spread all around the auditorium. With all the people coming to the cinema and eating the sweets and ice creams they have a full skip of rubbish a day. There are approximatly 25 staff working at the cinema but not together. The cinema in Leamington Spa is a good, comfortable cinema. It has good refreshment facilities, also the films are amusing and interesting.
